column4: the contents of a deb package are installed into the linux filesystem as described in https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LinuxFilesystemTreeOverview, as well as some leeway in where certain files go
so how will creating a separate partition as a /home partition would help me if I reinstall ubuntu on a different filesystem-partition?
because you would keep all your personal files - documents, personal settings, and anything else in your user directory
it won't keep the applications installed through apt or dpkg.
